messages.message:
~since https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/62474 was merged, i think all Cypress CI runs off of master won’t work unless we re-deploy crafting-cyp to include the Pollen upgrade (ex: 14028 (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14028), 14027 (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14027))~

i’ll trigger a deployment to crafting-cyp now to unblock Cypress CI

[EDIT] the correct fix is to delete the PR sandbox and rerun Cypress CI (see https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1721775204595539)
Do we not install all the dependencies based on individual PRs in Crafting? How did this PR pass Cypress if we are not doing it :thinking_face:

i’m confused too…

i see this error on all pages
Or maybe you could go into the sandbox and yarn install manually
This warning is not showing in https://crafting-cyp.test.instabase.com/  but in the linked sandbox only
oops i think jessica is right, we probably didn’t re-install node modules if CI is re-run for an existing PR
Ah yes, that's correct. We skip if cache hit: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/d684c6b963f337c34f196ff7277bc666e9e25f66/.github/workflows/cypress.yml#L58

should i cancel the crafting-cyp upgrade (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/SAAS-AWS/job/deploy-saas-aws-preprod/24135/console) then? it’s pretty early on in the build process, so it should be fine to cancel
Sure. (although I'm scared because i can't never get sandbox deployment to work right)
ok i’ve also never cancelled an upgrade via jenkins, so i’ll leave it for now to avoid causing unexpected issues
btw the upgrade is done now! https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/SAAS-AWS/job/deploy-saas-aws-preprod/24135/
